{"step_by_step_thinking": "Propofol is a short-acting, intravenously administered hypnotic/amnestic agent. Its uses include the induction and maintenance of general anesthesia, sedation for mechanically ventilated adults, and procedural sedation. So options A, B, and D are correct. Propofol is also known for its rapid recovery rate due to its short duration of action. However, propofol does not typically cause vomiting after use. In fact, it is often associated with a lower incidence of postoperative nausea and vomiting compared to many other anesthetic agents.", "answer_choice": "C"}
